These are the standard commands and parameters of a basic DITA OT build. Here is what these commands and parameters mean:

li.p: bin\dita (Windows) or ./bin/dita (Mac) is the command that generates output from DITA
-i (the input parameter) indicates that the filepath that follows it to a DITA map or file needs to be transformed into output.

-f (the transtype parameter) indicates that the string that follows it is the output transformation type (also called the “transtype”). Some common transtype values include “pdf” for PDF output, “xhtml” and for HTML output.

-o (the output parameter) indicates where to store the generated output. This parameter is optional; if you do not use it to specify an output directory, the output is placed in the DITA OT’s default “out” folder.

-v (the verbose parameter) indicates verbose output, which displays a log of the DITA OT build in the command window. This parameter is optional, but it is useful to watch the DITA OT run in real-time to help troubleshoot errors.

lcInstruction.p: You can use additional parameters to add more specifications about the build you’re running. To explore all the options available to you, see the DITA Open Toolkit Parameter Reference.
